title: Garen has always just been "worse" Darius, can we fix that?
body:
Every other Juggernaut has their niche, yet Garen's entire "niche" relies on a gimmick that should have never been put into his kit to begin with.
There's literally no reason to pick him over any other Juggernaut when you could just pick Darius, or hell, even Mordekaiser.

He's a VERY binary champion with no real niche and ways to outplay or be outplayed and it's really showing in how historically he's always been a just a noob champion everyone just drops once they figure out the game.

He NEEDS something to make him a desirable pick, and with the new Demacia Lore update I feel there's already a pretty good thematic niche to explore with him.
"ANTI MAGE Juggernaut"

Demacia's entire lore is riddled with Demacians despising magic and being extremely good at containing it and destroying it, so why don't we make Garen just the Juggernaut you'd pick against heavy AP teams?

He already has a silence that's better against mages than AD champions so why don't we try and shape him to be more effective dealing with magic damage dealers?
He does wear Demacian armour, forged with Petricite so it's only logical he'd have more Magic-countering abilities.

_____________________________________

Hell, we could just scrap his passive and give him an actual combat bonus:
->Make him take 75% of incoming magic damage directly and the remaining 25% as a DoT over some seconds while giving him a soft heal of 2% max hp over 2 seconds?

Or make his ultimate purge the magic from his enemies, making him just better at taking them down?


I dunno, just throwing around ideas here, I just feel for Garen to ever be a good champion he needs to become less binary and get a proper niche!

Maybe we could get a SECOND Juggernaut class update to fix up the rest of them who are struggling.

I see posts like this a lot in the boards. A lot of people want to make X champion more complex. Think about the new players. They need to start from something simple. The game is already hostile to noobs as it is.
Warwick is a great example of a champion that gained a lot of depth with his rework, but remained simple for new players like he is intended to be.
I still believe Warwick is the best rework they've done yet because they hit every aspect dead on.

{{champion:14}} ''How can you improve on something... that is flawless!''

IMO, Sion is still the best one they've ever done, but Warwick was great too

WW players still have WW.  Sion players have Aatrox as the closest thing to what they had.  I am not saying new Sion is bad (I don't play him much but I like him), but I still resent the removal of Sion from the game.
Honestly I think some people got too attached to the unhealthy aspects.

>Lulu’s prevalence as a solo laner was characterized by a combination of strengths she made little trade-offs for, making laning against her a particularly frustrating affair. We solved this by transferring some of her lane clearing power into team utility, hitting her ability to poke champions in the process. ***Now that the Fae Sorceress sports a healthier clearing pattern, we’re comfortable giving her some offensive power back in a way that augments both her support and solo playstyles.***

Sion was the epitome of "unhealthy". He had 2 builds paths. One of them could 2 shot you with a hard cc for half your hp. Lol. And the other had damage that rivaled yi, while having enough sustain to drain tank while in the enemies fountain. Lol. Good times.

Basically what Ralanr said, and his VO was basically a joke, just like GP's.
Sion was... a mess of a champion, I'm honestly surprised about how much of him remained.
The Exploding shield is still there, the health stacking is still there, his old ultimate is kiiinda still there in his passive, and his stun is still there but in a different way. Similar to what they did with Taric's E/Q or Galio/Warwick's Q, y'know?

If you start with a champion, and you see that people are attached to some of the Character's main issues, It's hard to keep too much of 'm around.

___

That's why I don't think Riot made the mistake of ''Removing Sion'', people were just attached to the specific things that needed to be removed.
